background-white.$description: If you need a white background use this token

background-pale.$description: If you need a grey background use this token. Note: this token replaces the current Background colour style.

background-faint.$description: If you need a light grey background use this token. Note: this token replaces the current Light colour style. Do not use this token as a screen background.

background-primary.$description: Use for embellishment eg. hero banners etc. Warning. Accessibility is not guaranteed

background-hero.$description: Use for embellishment eg. hero banners etc. Warning. Accessibility is not guaranteed

surface-muted-vivid.$description: Use for surfaces that need to be the same colour as body text (icons, arrows etc).

surface-muted.$description: Replaces the current Muted colour style.

surface-muted-pale.$description: Replaces the current Background colour style. Tip: In light mode this colour is the same as background-pale however they behave differently in dark mode.

surface-muted-faint.$description: Replaces the current Light colour style. Tip: In light mode this colour is the same as background-faint however they each behave differently in dark mode.

surface-primary.$description: Replaces the current Primary colour style.

surface-hero.$description: Replaces the current Hero colour style.

surface-pop.$description: Replaces the current Pop colour style. Use for embellishment only as it may not be accessible in all brands. Always use sparingly and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

surface-pop-faint.$description: Replaces the current Pop Light colour style. Use for embellishment only as it may not be accessible in all brands. Always use sparingly and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

surface-holler.$description: Use with caution: GEL cannot endorse the use of this colour token until it's approved and documented as part of the Master Brand. This applies to all our brands.

surface-holler-faint.$description: Use with caution: GEL cannot endorse the use of this colour token until it's approved and documented as part of the Master Brand. This applies to all our brands.

surface-success.$description: Only use for success alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-success-faint.$description: Only use for success alert components, do not use for anything else. Note: this surface should always be used with border-success-mild as shown here.

surface-info.$description: Only use for info alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-info-faint.$description: Only use for info alert components, do not use for anything else. Note: this surface should always be used with border-info-mild as shown here.

surface-warning.$description: Only use for warning alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-warning-faint.$description: Only use for warning alert components, do not use for anything else. Note: this surface should always be used with border-warning-mild as shown here.

surface-danger.$description: Only use for danger alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-danger-faint.$description: Only use for danger alert components, do not use for anything else. Note: this surface should always be used with border-danger-mild as shown here.

surface-system-error.$description: Only use for system alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-system-error-dark.$description: Only use for system alert components, do not use for anything else.

surface-mono.$description: White in light mode and black in dark mode. Use with caution, black often creates too much contrast which defeats the object of reducing glare. Tip: Use background-white. This will provide the same results with less contrast in dark mode.

surface-reversed.$description: Always white. Use with caution, in Dark Mode white often creates too much contrast which defeats the object of reducing glare. Tip: Use surface-mono or background-white as these tokens are designed to work in dark mode.

text-body.$description: Use for paragraph text and UI elements - labels, buttons, inputs etc

text-heading.$description: Use for headings only. Note: Using text-heading on anything other than headings may produce unexpected results in multi-brand applications.

text-muted.$description: Use for text that requires less emphasis like hint text etc.

text-primary.$description: Use with caution and in accordance with the brand guidelines. Tip: If your text is a link always use the text-link token.

text-hero.$description: Use for text that requires more emphasis, call outs, quotes etc.

text-holler.$description: Use for text that requires more emphasis, call outs, quotes etc. Note: GEL cannot endorse the use of this colour token until it's approved and documented as part of the Master Brand. This applies to all our brands.

text-link.$description: Use for text links only. Note: In Westpac this colour is exactly the same as text-primary however this may not be the case in other brands.

text-success.$description: Only for success alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

text-info.$description: Only for info alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

text-warning.$description: Only for warning alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

text-danger.$description: Only for danger alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

text-system-error.$description: Only for system error alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

text-mono.$description: Similar to surface-mono, text-mono is white in light mode and black in dark mode. Itâ€™s typically used for UI elements like buttons, tabs, panel heading etc.

text-reversed.$description: Similar to surface-reversed, text-reversed is always white. Use with caution, in dark mode white creates too much contrast which defeats the object of reducing glare. Tip: Try using text-mono

border-muted.$description: For borders that require more emphasis. Use with caution and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

border-muted-strong.$description: Replaces the current Border Dark colour style. Use for UI components that require accessible contrast ratios eg. Inputs, Selects etc

border-muted-soft.$description: Replaces the current Border colour style. Use for UI components and page elements that donâ€™t require accessible borders - Selectors, Flexi-cell, Tabs, section dividers etc

border-hero.$description: For borders that require more emphasis. Use with caution and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

border-primary.$description: For borders that require more emphasis. Use with caution and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

border-pop.$description: For borders that require more emphasis. Use with caution and in accordance with the brand guidelines.

border-holler.$description: For borders that require more emphasis. Note: GEL cannot endorse the use of this colour token until it's approved and documented as part of the Master Brand. This applies to all our brands.

border-success.$description: Only for success alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-success-mild.$description: Only for success alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-info.$description: Only for info alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-info-mild.$description: Only for success info messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-warning.$description: Only for warning alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-warning-mild.$description: Only for warning alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-danger.$description: Reserved. Must only be used for the Danger alert component.

border-danger-mild.$description: Only for danger alert messages, do not use for anything else. Tip: Use the pre-built alert message components.

border-mono.$description: Similar to surface-mono, border-mono is white in light mode and black in dark mode.

border-focus.$description: Reserved. Only for use with focus state keyboard navigation.

data-a-solid.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-a-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-a-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-b-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-b-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-c-solid.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-c-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-c-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-d-solid.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-d-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-d-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-e-solid.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-e-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-e-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-f-solid.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-f-tint.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

data-f-opacity.$description: This is a reserved colour. It must only be used for data visualisation - graphs and charts.

surface-pictogram-base.$description: Reserved. Only for use on Pictograms.

surface-pictogram-accent.$description: Reserved. Only for use on Pictograms.

surface-hover-primary.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-hover-hero.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-active-hero.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-hover-primary-faint.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-active-primary-faint.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-hover-muted-pale.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-active-muted-pale.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-hover-mono.$description: This token is for hover states.

surface-active-mono.$description: This token is for hover states.
